author: The Editorial Board
title: Operation Muppet Freedom
text:
One place you might not expect to find the federal government is Saturday morning cartoons. Yet the Federal Communications Commission has for years regulated children’s programming, and it will soon revisit these superannuated rules, which is a victory for what one might call Muppet innovation.
The 1990 Children’s Television Act required broadcasters to include children’s education and information as part of programming, and over time the FCC developed conditions. Three hours of programming on average must air between 7 a.m....
